hero.subtitle: Wherever we go, we want to go together

story.title: Our story
story.p1: One day our eyes met, and that—without exaggeration—changed my life. I’m grateful that Vašek is willing to tie in with me and climb through the mountains and valleys of our shared story.
story.p2: We met on a pilgrimage, and somehow we didn’t notice it had already ended. And so now we keep walking through life together.

program.title: The wedding day is coming
program.dateText: We look forward to seeing you on June 6, 2026
program.introText: We are stepping into a new chapter of our life together and we’ll be truly grateful if you spend this day with us. We can’t wait to see all of you—our family, friends, and everyone close to us.

timeline.photosChurch: Photos in front of the church

program.note: The schedule is approximate. Only the Mass time is fixed.

prayer.title: Prayer stones
prayer.p1: Would you like to support our wedding from afar and aren’t sure how? Here’s a chance just for you! Pause for a moment and reflect. A short wish or prayer—or even a quote for this occasion—is enough. We’ll write your short text on a small stone. We hope they’ll pave the way all the way to our big day.
prayer.p2: P.S. Feel free to think of a wedding wish for us as well—but there will be time for that later.

mass.title: Holy Mass
mass.p1: The wedding ceremony will take place during a Holy Mass, which is the most important part of the whole day for us. It will last about one hour to an hour and a half.
mass.p2: During Mass, people switch between different postures—standing, sitting, or kneeling. Most people simply follow what others are doing, but for you this is definitely not an obligation. Do only what you feel comfortable with. No gesture is required.
mass.p3: Mass also includes Holy Communion. Those who are prepared come forward to receive the Eucharist. If you can’t or don’t want to receive this sacrament, you have two simple options:
mass.p4:
• stay seated in your place, or
• join the line and ask the priest for a blessing.
mass.p5: If you choose the second option, simply place your raised index finger in front of your lips (the same gesture as asking for silence). The priest will understand that you are not receiving Communion, but coming for a blessing.

accommodation.title: Accommodation
accommodation.p1: Right next to the church there is an area where we will move after the wedding Mass. Accommodation is available either in rooms at the parish house or in outdoor cabins. There are 4 rooms in the parish house with 3 to 6 beds—17 beds total. There are eight outdoor cabins, each for four people—32 beds total.

drivers.title: Drivers
drivers.text: Our wonderful drivers can safely take you home from the evening reception, and after lunch they can also help you move your car from the venue to wherever you need.

faq.title: Answers to your questions
faq.a1: Parking is possible down the bend below the church, by the Chapel of Our Lady of La Salette, or in Javorník, from where our drivers will bring you. Everything is clearly marked.
faq.a2: Our wedding won’t be a completely formal event, but we’ll be happy to see you in nice and comfortable clothes. The main thing is to celebrate together.
faq.q3: What about food—will there be vegetarian / gluten-free options?
faq.a3: Yes. Please let us know via the RSVP form if you have special requirements. We’ll be happy to adapt if it’s at least somewhat within our possibilities.
faq.q4: Can we stay overnight at the venue?
faq.a4: Yes, we’ll be very happy if you can stay. You can come to the parish house a few days early, and you don’t have to leave right after the wedding. More information is in the Accommodation section.
faq.q5: Do you have an idea for a fun / interesting activity?
faq.a5: We’ll be happy for any idea. Please coordinate its implementation with Pavlínka—the bride’s witness.
faq.q6: I would like to give the newlyweds a gift…
faq.q7: Can I do anything else to help?
faq.a7:
Yes! We’ll be very happy if you join our Prayer Stones—together we’ll read the texts two weeks before the wedding during our preparation weekend in Travná.
And it would also mean a lot if you keep us in mind in any way—
- for us as newlyweds, that we enter marriage with love, forgiveness, unity, and peace
- for the preparations, that they are a time of meeting, joy, and creating together
- and for everyone involved, that our day becomes a blessing for everyone who comes
